p: One of the determinants of aquaculture is the outbreak of diseases, and chemotherapy that includes antibiotics is one of the main methods of disease control; however, due to the heightened apprehension about the effects of long-term use (e.g., the production of resistant pathogens strains, aggregation of toxic residues, depletion of the immune system, and environmental hazards), their use in different countries has been discouraged [ 56, 57]. Currently, eco-friendly natural strategies and/or alternatives to antibiotics, such as medicinal herbs and beneficial microorganisms (probiotics, prebiotics, and synbiotics), have become an area of interest of many studies [ 58, 59, 60].
